name: RadarBackend(DEV)
description: Contains all the Radar Backend APIs to run on DevRadar

requests.name: BuildMilestone
requests.description:
Purpose: Updates a build (i.e. a record in BuildRecords) to a particular milestone. History of previous milestones is maintained.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue.

•	HTTP 400 – If this operation is invalid, i.e. if you are trying to go back to a previous milestone. You can only move forwards.

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server.

Notes
•	Values for BuildMilestone are pre-defined in a BuildMilestones table in the database. Passing an invalid value for build milestone will result in HTTP 400.

requests.tests: tests["Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;
requests.name: BuildMilestone(GET)
requests.description:
Purpose: This will return a list of the active build milestones.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 500 if an error occurs.

requests.name: QualityGate(Post)
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to add new Quality Gates to the database.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 if an error occurs, with a descriptive error message.
{"Error": "An active Quality Gate with this name already exists - exiting."}

Notes

•	The ‘Name’ attribute must be unique. Insertion will fail otherwise. Name cannot be changed later, it is used as a unique identifier for each quality gate.

requests.name: BuildSearch
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used by Orbit to search for the latest build of the given component with the given milestone. Note that if useExactMilestone is set to true, then we’ll just take the latest build that matches the given milestone. If it is set to false then we will take the build that meets the criteria that is at the highest build milestone.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 500 if an error occurs.

requests.name: TestRecord
requests.description:
Purpose: This adds a test record to the database for a test run, and the suites that are to be executed. TestCaseResult then can be used to add individual test case results for this test record.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully, along with a unique TestRecordID to be used on all subsequent calls of TestCaseResult, which is used to add individual test case results.
{
"TestRecordId": "3"
}

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{
   "Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"
}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.


Notes

•	BuildRecordID is the unique ID of this build record in the Radar database (not the build number or anything else). Please talk to Paul/Jimmy/Mark if you don’t understand this.

•	This API adds the top-level record of a test run and stores the information about the suites. TestCaseResult should be used for storing individual test case results as they run.

•	Valid values for Platform are currently (case is irrelevant) – Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 10, Windows 10 November Update, Windows 10 Anniversary Update, OSX, Linux.

•	Value values for Architecture are currently (case is irrelevant) – x86, x64.

requests.name: BuildRecord(GET)
requests.description:
Purpose: Given a build ID, this will return a JSON response listing the build metadata and a list of the associated build steps and their results.

Notes
•	If there isn’t a build for the build record ID passed, an empty response is returned.

requests.name: QualityGateUpdate
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to update an existing quality gate in the database.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.
Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 if an error occurs, with a descriptive error message.
{"Error": "The Quality Gate specified to update doesn't seem to exist - exiting."}

Notes

•	New rows are added each time a quality gate is updated – previous records are marked as inactive and retained. This is because these may have been used in previous builds, and we’ll need to retain a record of what the values were at this time.

•	Right now, Quality Gate names cannot be changed after they are created. This can be fixed a future version if required. Quality Gate names need to be unique.

•	FIXME: Tie up Quality Gates to Build Records later once we are ready.

requests.name: BuildRecord copy
requests.description:
Purpose: Add data to the BuildRecords table. This is the high level record for a particular build. This would be called as the build is initiated.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 with JSON that lists the new ID of this record in the Radar system. This is the unique ‘BuildRecordID’ parameter that will need to be passed with all subsequent API calls, e.g.
{"BuildRecordID":"1"}

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{"Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildNumber'"}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.


Notes

•	The following are validated as against what is in the database: Solution, SolutionVersion, Product, ProductVersion, Component, ComponentVersion. If these are not valid the server will return a HTTP 400 and a descriptive JSON error message, e.g.
{"Error":"Product Name specified does not exist in the database."}

•	Error emails are available also.

•	Each BuildRecord is timestamped as it is added to the
database (using the current server time).

•	Values for BuildMilestone are pre-defined in a BuildMilestones table in the database. Passing an invalid value for build milestone will result in an error response similar to above.

•	You cannot submit data for the same build number twice. E.g. if there are results for build 100 already, you will receive an error message.

requests.name: BuildResult
requests.description:
Purpose: This add the final result for a build in the build records table.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.
Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{
   "Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"
}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

requests.name: BuildMilestoneProgressions
requests.description:
Purpose: This will return a JSON representation of the build milestones to which this build record ID is allowed to progress from its current milestone.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 500 if an error occurs

requests.name: BuildStep
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to add build step data to the BuildSteps table, which contains the steps that happened within a particular build. This would be called as each step in the build completes.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{
   "Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"
}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

Notes

•	Step names can be anything you want. Step results also. (May want to standardize step results).

•	Each BuildStep is timestamped as it is added to the database (using the current server time).

•	The overall build milestone can be updated at any time by calling the BuildMilestone function (described later in this document).

•	If the step already exists for the given build record Id, then the result is just updated rather than a new step created.

requests.name: QualityGates
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to retrieve quality gates from the Radar database as JSON for consumption in the build system or Radar UI.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 500 if an error occurs

requests.name: BuildMilestoneHistory
requests.description:
Purpose: This will return a JSON representation of the build milestone history of the given build record ID.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 500 if an error occurs.

requests.name: HighLevelBuildReport(BuildRecordID)
requests.description: Purpose: This allows the retrieval of a high level KPI summary for a particular build.

requests.name: BuildRecord
requests.description:
Purpose: Add data to the BuildRecords table. This is the high level record for a particular build. This would be called as the build is initiated.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 with JSON that lists the new ID of this record in the Radar system. This is the unique ‘BuildRecordID’ parameter that will need to be passed with all subsequent API calls, e.g.
{"BuildRecordID":"1"}

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{"Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildNumber'"}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.


Notes

•	The following are validated as against what is in the database: Solution, SolutionVersion, Product, ProductVersion, Component, ComponentVersion. If these are not valid the server will return a HTTP 400 and a descriptive JSON error message, e.g.
{"Error":"Product Name specified does not exist in the database."}

•	Error emails are available also.

•	Each BuildRecord is timestamped as it is added to the
database (using the current server time).

•	Values for BuildMilestone are pre-defined in a BuildMilestones table in the database. Passing an invalid value for build milestone will result in an error response similar to above.

•	You cannot submit data for the same build number twice. E.g. if there are results for build 100 already, you will receive an error message.

requests.name: TestResults
requests.description: Purpose: This allows the retrieval of the Test case results for the given BuildRecordId.

requests.name: HighLevelBuildReport
requests.description: Purpose: This allows the retrieval of a high level KPI summary for a particular build.

requests.name: CoverityResults
requests.description:
Purpose: This allows the addition of Coverity results. These are tied to specific build records.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{
   "Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"
}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

requests.name: BuildRecord copy
requests.description:
Purpose: Add data to the BuildRecords table. This is the high level record for a particular build. This would be called as the build is initiated.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 with JSON that lists the new ID of this record in the Radar system. This is the unique ‘BuildRecordID’ parameter that will need to be passed with all subsequent API calls, e.g.
{"BuildRecordID":"1"}

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{"Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildNumber'"}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.


Notes

•	The following are validated as against what is in the database: Solution, SolutionVersion, Product, ProductVersion, Component, ComponentVersion. If these are not valid the server will return a HTTP 400 and a descriptive JSON error message, e.g.
{"Error":"Product Name specified does not exist in the database."}

•	Error emails are available also.

•	Each BuildRecord is timestamped as it is added to the
database (using the current server time).

•	Values for BuildMilestone are pre-defined in a BuildMilestones table in the database. Passing an invalid value for build milestone will result in an error response similar to above.

•	You cannot submit data for the same build number twice. E.g. if there are results for build 100 already, you will receive an error message.

requests.name: CoverityResults(GET)
requests.description:
Purpose: This allows the retrieval of Coverity results for a specific build record.

Notes

•	If there isn’t a build for the build record ID passed, an empty response is returned

requests.name: TestCaseResult
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used in conjunction with TestRecord to add test results to the database. This requires a unique TestRecordId to be passed (returned from TestRecord) with each call. This is what ties tests to build records.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if test case result was added successfully.
Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{
   "Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"
}

•	HTTP 400 is also returned if the test suite specified does not exist in the database. This should have been passed in TestRecord.

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

requests.name: TestRecordResult
requests.description:
Purpose: This adds the overall result for a test record. This would be called after adding all the test case results. It would need to be enumerated by the test automation.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.
Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue.

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

Notes

The following are the only valid values for ‘TestResults’ (case is irrelevant) – passed, failed, pending.

requests.name: VerDirResults(GET)
requests.description:
Purpose: This returns the VerDir results for the build record ID passed in the query string (i.e. 1 in the above example.

Notes
•	If no VerDir results exist for that build, an empty response is returned.

requests.name: ArtifactoryUrl
requests.description:
Purpose: This can be used to add an Artifactory link to the BuildRecords table for a build once the build is completed. This can be used by downstream teams to get the link to build artefacts for testing etc.

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.
Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{
   "Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"
}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

requests.name: VerDirResults
requests.description:
Purpose: This adds results for VerDir. It will potentially update two tables, VerDirResults and VerDirFailures (only if there are failures to report).

Returns

•	HTTP 200 if the data was added successfully.

Error Codes

•	HTTP 400 – Data passed was invalid. A descriptive JSON is returned outlining the issue, e.g.
{"Error":"Expected a non-null integer for property: 'BuildRecordID'"}

•	HTTP 500 – An error occurred on the server, in this instance the message from the stack track is passed back in a JSON response similar to above.

Notes

•	For each error for a particular file, a new row will be added in the VerDirFailures table.
requests.rawModeData:
{
